title: Learner-Generated Digital Storytelling Design and Application for [K-12] Education

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in basic digital tool usage and foundational knowledge of social studies
context.additional_context: Learners perform digital storytelling projects using personal devices (tablets, smartphones, etc.), focusing on creating works centered on social issues

learning_goals: Learners can independently produce a 3-minute video by applying the five-stage digital storytelling process (planning-structuring-production-editing-presentation).
Learners can utilize narrative structures and visual expression techniques while designing storyboards with social themes.
Learners can improve final outputs by incorporating feedback through peer evaluation.

resources: Free Digital Editing Software (e.g., CapCut, iMovie)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
